column1: Karabük Province (Turkish: Karabük ili) is a landlocked province in the northern part of Anatolia (northern central Turkey)
column2: located about 200 km (124 mi) north of Ankara
column3: 115 km (71 mi) away from Zonguldak and 113 km (70 mi) away from Kastamonu. In 2010 it had a population of 227
column4: 610. The main city is Karabük which is located about 100 km (62 mi) south of the Black Sea coast.

column1: Karabük Province is one of the newest provinces of Turkey. Until 1995 it was a district of Zonguldak
column2: when it became an il (provincial center) in its own right. Established in 1995
column5: Safranbolu and Yenice districts which were formerly part of Zonguldak Province and Eskipazar and Ovacık districts which were previously part of Çankırı Province.

column1: Karabük is located on the highway between Bartın and Ankara
column2: which was in ancient times an important route between Amasra on the coast and central Anatolia. The railway between Ankara and Zonguldak passes through Karabük.
